alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 19 at 3:03PM CDT until June 19 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON COUNTY... At 303 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Helena, or near Moss Point, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Moss Point and Escatawpa. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 67 and 76. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
